objects.description: Returns the set of established categories as defined in configuration.
objects.name: getCategories

objects.comment:
/**
* Adds a new category to the set of known categories
* @param category
*/
objects.description: Adds a new category to the set of known categories
objects.name: addCategory

objects.comment:
/**
* Removes a category from the set of known categories
* @param category
*/
objects.description: Removes a category from the set of known categories
objects.name: removeCategory

objects.comment:
/**
* Loads the logger configuration JSON from the given path and sets the configuration.
* This establishes the loggers and output writers, as well as category and level
* definitions, color settings, and output formats to use.
* See the documentation section on Configuration for more information.
*
* Available in Node settings.  For browser-based contexts, load your config
* via a script or AJAX operation and call `setLoggerConfig` rather than use this method.
*
* @throws Error if Node is not available or file is not found at path.
*
* @param path
*/
objects.description:
Loads the logger configuration JSON from the given path and sets the configuration.
This establishes the loggers and output writers, as well as category and level
definitions, color settings, and output formats to use.
See the documentation section on Configuration for more information.

Available in Node settings.  For browser-based contexts, load your config
via a script or AJAX operation and call `setLoggerConfig` rather than use this method.

exceptions.description: Error if Node is not available or file is not found at path.

objects.name: loadLoggerConfig

objects.comment:
/**
* Sets the configuration from a JSON text string.
* If you've loaded a parsed script, or have constructed a JS object,
* call `setLoggerConfig` instead.
* @param json
*/
objects.description:
Sets the configuration from a JSON text string.
If you've loaded a parsed script, or have constructed a JS object,
call `setLoggerConfig` instead.
objects.name: setLoggerConfigJSON

objects.comment:
/**
* Use to set the Logger configuration from an object resolved from JSON or
* constructed dynamically.
* Use in browser-based contexts, since `loadLoggerConfig` in unavailable without Node support.
* This establishes the loggers and output writers, as well as category and level
* definitions, color settings, and output formats to use.
* See the documentation section on Configuration for more information.
* @param config
*/
objects.description:
Use to set the Logger configuration from an object resolved from JSON or
constructed dynamically.
Use in browser-based contexts, since `loadLoggerConfig` in unavailable without Node support.
This establishes the loggers and output writers, as well as category and level
definitions, color settings, and output formats to use.
See the documentation section on Configuration for more information.
objects.name: setLoggerConfig

objects.comment:
/**
* Return a configured Logger by name
* @param name
*/
objects.description: Return a configured Logger by name
objects.name: getLogger

objects.comment:
/**
* Read the accumulated text in the named memory log.
* Note that the name of a Memory log is established with the 'memoryName' property of
* the writer configuration, or the name of the writer itself if no 'memoryName' is provided.
* See the section on Configuration for more info.
*
* @param name
*/
objects.description:
Read the accumulated text in the named memory log.
Note that the name of a Memory log is established with the 'memoryName' property of
the writer configuration, or the name of the writer itself if no 'memoryName' is provided.
See the section on Configuration for more info.
objects.name: readMemoryLog

objects.comment:
/**
* Clears the memory buffer text for this Memory log.
* @param name
*/
objects.description: Clears the memory buffer text for this Memory log.
objects.name: clearMemoryLog

objects.classdesc: A target names the target type and location
objects.name: LogTarget
LogTarget

Defines where the output will appear, and what categories/levels are filtered
objects.name: LogWriter

objects.description: Returns the colors to use per display item for a given category and level
objects.name: getColors

objects.description: return the array of writers attached to this logger

/**
* Add a new writer to this logger

objects.name: addWriter

/**

*/

objects.comment:
/**
* Find a writer by name that belongs to this Logger
* @param targetName
*/
objects.description: Find a writer by name that belongs to this Logger

objects.comment:
/**
* Include all the levels in the writer output
* @param writerName - name of writer to affect
*/
objects.description: Include all the levels in the writer output
objects.name: includeAllLevels

objects.comment:
/**
* Exclude all levels from the writer output
* @param writerName - name of writer to affect
*/
objects.description: Exclude all levels from the writer output
objects.name: excludeAllLevels

objects.comment:
/**
* Include a level for the named writer to output
*
* @param writerName - name of writer to affect
* @param level - name of level. note that granular levels are not supported. Only primary level names.
*/
objects.description: Include a level for the named writer to output

params.description: name of level. note that granular levels are not supported. Only primary level names.
params.name: level

objects.name: includeLevel

objects.comment:
/**
* Exclude a level for the named writer.
* The writer will ignore all logs for this level
*
* @param writerName - name of writer to affect
* @param level - name of level. note that granular levels are not supported. Only primary level names.
*/
objects.description:
Exclude a level for the named writer.
The writer will ignore all logs for this level

params.description: name of level. note that granular levels are not supported. Only primary level names.
params.name: level

objects.name: excludeLevel

objects.comment:
/**
* Set a minimum level.
* This level and above will be output by the writer.
* levels below this will be excluded.
*
* @param writerName - name of writer to affect
* @param level - name of level. note that granular levels are not supported. Only primary level names.
*/
objects.description:
Set a minimum level.
This level and above will be output by the writer.
levels below this will be excluded.

params.description: name of level. note that granular levels are not supported. Only primary level names.
params.name: level

objects.name: setMininumLevel

objects.comment:
/**

objects.comment:
/**

objects.description: Include a category for the named writer to output
objects.name: includeCategory

objects.comment:
/**
* Exclude a category for the named writer.
* This writer will ignore logs in this category.
*
* @param writerName - name of writer to affect
* @param category -- name of category
*/
objects.description:
Exclude a category for the named writer.
This writer will ignore logs in this category.
objects.name: excludeCategory

objects.comment:
/**
* Private method that converts a string 'level' (e.g. 'info', 'debug3', etc)
* into the corresponding type (number) and suffix granularity.
* @param level
* @returns {{type, granularity}) (both properties are integers)
* @private
*/
objects.description:
Private method that converts a string 'level' (e.g. 'info', 'debug3', etc)
into the corresponding type (number) and suffix granularity.
objects.name: _levelToType

objects.comment:
/**
* Direct output to all writers, subject to filtering.
* @param {number} time  in milliseconds
* @param {{file, func, line, stack}} ffl
* @param {string} category
* @param {string} level
* @param {string} message
* @param {*} args arguments used for formatting message
*/
objects.description: Direct output to all writers, subject to filtering.
objects.name: outToWriters

objects.comment:
/**
* Handles passing category, message, args or simply message, args for any log level.
* @param level
* @param args
* @private
*/
objects.description: Handles passing category, message, args or simply message, args for any log level.
objects.name: _morph

objects.comment:
/**
* Declares the start of a contextual group of related log statements.
* In the ConsoleWriter, Log statements following a group declaration appear slightly indented so as to form
* a visually grouped collection.  The group block is preceded by a label tag announcing the name of the group.
*
* Other Writer implementations may handle `group` blocks in different ways.  Interactive log clients may support
* collapsible sections.
*
* Groups are concluded with `groupEnd` statments.
*
* Groups initiated when another group is active appear nested within the former group.
*
* @param name
*/
objects.description:
Declares the start of a contextual group of related log statements.
In the ConsoleWriter, Log statements following a group declaration appear slightly indented so as to form
a visually grouped collection.  The group block is preceded by a label tag announcing the name of the group.

Other Writer implementations may handle `group` blocks in different ways.  Interactive log clients may support
collapsible sections.

Groups are concluded with `groupEnd` statments.

Groups initiated when another group is active appear nested within the former group.
objects.name: group

objects.description: Marks the end of the current group.
objects.name: groupEnd

objects.comment:
//------------------------------------
/*
* Applies color for the ColorWriter.
* If an array is used, the first element represents the color of the foreground, and the second of the background.
* If a string is given, it is used as the foreground color.
*
* Colors may be a direct ANSI number (8-bit extended), a three digit hex ('#ABC'), six-digit hex ('#123456'),
* or 'rgb()' statement.
*
* Undefined or '' entries are no-ops.
*
* @param strOrArray
* @returns {string}
*/
objects.name: applyColor

objects.comment: // Used by applyColor
objects.name: parseColor

objects.comment:
// TODO: Handle the first 16 colors (primary, bright)
// Used by applyColor
objects.name: rgb2ansiCode

objects.comment:
/**
* Read the target (.js) file and find the //# sourceMappingURL= tag
* then, either decode the date or read the referenced map file depending upon url type
*
* Record this as the mapData for this file path for later lookup.
* Note that in 'Sniff' the first part (making a mapData table) is done as a post-build tool activity
* and the resulting JSON is read in so we have a preconstructed source map table at the start.
*
* @param filePath Path of the file (note: full path, not just the name)
*/
objects.description:
Read the target (.js) file and find the //# sourceMappingURL= tag
then, either decode the date or read the referenced map file depending upon url type

Record this as the mapData for this file path for later lookup.
Note that in 'Sniff' the first part (making a mapData table) is done as a post-build tool activity
and the resulting JSON is read in so we have a preconstructed source map table at the start.

params.description: Path of the file (note: full path, not just the name)
params.name: filePath

objects.name: readMapData

objects.comment:
/**
* From the already parsed FuncFileLine data from StackLineParser,
* find the referenced source map data and decode it to find the corresponding
* source file and line values.  Update the FFL object in place.
* Resulting FFL will also contain the source file path.
*
* @param ffl FuncFileLine object that is modified with source map information and returned
* @return Modified FFL is also returned
*/
objects.description:
From the already parsed FuncFileLine data from StackLineParser,
find the referenced source map data and decode it to find the corresponding
source file and line values.  Update the FFL object in place.
Resulting FFL will also contain the source file path.

params.description: FuncFileLine object that is modified with source map information and returned
params.name: ffl

objects.name: getSourceMap
